TEXT.English: Please support [OUR_CIV_SHORT] and its people. We depend on your help!
TEXT.French: Veuillez soutenir le [OUR_CIV_SHORT] et son peuple. Nous avons besoin de votre aide !
TEXT.German: Please support [OUR_CIV_SHORT] and it's people. We depend on your help!
TEXT.Italian: Please support [OUR_CIV_SHORT] and it's people. We depend on your help!
TEXT.Spanish: Please support [OUR_CIV_SHORT] and it's people. We depend on your help!

TEXT.English: This will be of mutual benefit for us both, don't you think so?
TEXT.French: Ceci nous bénéficiera mutuellement, ne croyez-vous pas ?
TEXT.German: This will be of mutual benefit for us both, don't you think so?
TEXT.Italian: This will be of mutual benefit for us both, don't you think so?
TEXT.Spanish: This will be of mutual benefit for us both, don't you think so?

TEXT.English: Hail and well met, [CT_NAME]! I am [OUR_NAME], ruler of the glorious [OUR_CIV_SHORT]. So tell me: does [CT_CIV_SHORT] have a lot of rich and unprotected coastal cities, or what?
TEXT.French: Bonjour, [CT_NAME], c'est un vrai plaisir ! Je suis [OUR_NAME], chef des glorieux [OUR_CIV_SHORT]. Dites-moi : est-ce que [CT_CIV_SHORT] dispose de nombreuses villes côtières riches et faiblement protégées ?
TEXT.German: Tag auch, [CT_NAME]! Ich bin [OUR_NAME], Staatsoberhaupt des ruhmreichen Volkes von [OUR_CIV_SHORT]. Nun, dann erzählt mal: Besitzt Ihr vielleicht ein paar reiche, schutzlose Küstenstädte?
TEXT.Italian: Salute a te, [CT_NAME]! Io sono [OUR_NAME], glorioso sovrano [OUR_CIV_ADJ]. Parliamo, dunque: [CT_CIV_SHORT] ha molte città costiere ricche e poco protette, vero?
TEXT.Spanish: Saludos y bienaventuranzas, [CT_NAME]. Soy [OUR_NAME], dirigente de la gloriosa tierra de [OUR_CIV_SHORT]. Decidme, ¿tiene o no [CT_CIV_SHORT] muchas ciudades costeras prósperas e indefensas?

TEXT.English: Mighty [OUR_NAME], all-powerful god-king of [OUR_CIV_SHORT] welcomes you, [CT_NAME]! Feel free to grovel in terror and awe if the mood takes you.
TEXT.French: [OUR_NAME], tout puissant roi et divinité des [OUR_CIV_SHORT], vous souhaite la bienvenue, [CT_NAME] ! N'hésitez pas à vous prosterner devant moi ou à vous étaler à mes pieds si le cœur vous en dit !
TEXT.German: Ich, [OUR_NAME], allmächtiges Staatsoberhaupt des Volkes von [OUR_CIV_SHORT], heiße Euch willkommen, [CT_NAME]! Es steht Euch frei, ehrfürchtig vor mir niederzuknien, wenn Euch danach ist.
TEXT.Italian: Il potente [OUR_NAME], onnipotente e divino leader [OUR_CIV_ADJ] ti dà il benvenuto, [CT_NAME]! Prostrati pure in preda al terrore e alla meraviglia, se ne hai voglia.
TEXT.Spanish: El gran [OUR_NAME], rey dios todopoderoso de [OUR_CIV_SHORT] os da la bienvenida, [CT_NAME]. Podéis postraros ante mí presa de un temor reverencial si se os antoja.

TEXT.English: Our armies are evenly matched, but I believe in a battle I would win out. So that this does not occur I ask you to meet our demands.
TEXT.French: Nos armées sont de force égale, mais je crois que je gagnerais en cas de bataille. Afin que cela ne se produise pas, je vous demande de satisfaire nos exigences.
TEXT.German: Helfen hei?t br?derlich teilen, [CT_NAME].
TEXT.Italian: Se ci tieni a me, condividi, [CT_NAME].
TEXT.Spanish: Compartir es de generosos, [CT_NAME].

TEXT.English: [OUR_CIV_SHORT] needs this and demands your assistance!
TEXT.French: [OUR_CIV_SHORT] a besoin de ceci et demande votre aide !
TEXT.German: [OUR_CIV_SHORT] needs this and demands your assistance!
TEXT.Italian: [OUR_CIV_SHORT] needs this and demands your assistance!
TEXT.Spanish: [OUR_CIV_SHORT] needs this and demands your assistance!

TEXT.English: Brazil is strong in many ways, [CT_NAME]. Do not force me to show you how strong.
TEXT.French: Le Brésil est fort, [CT_NAME]. Ne me poussez pas à vous montrer à quel point.
TEXT.German: Brazil is strong in many ways, [CT_NAME]. Do not force me to show you how strong.
TEXT.Italian: Brazil is strong in many ways, [CT_NAME]. Do not force me to show you how strong.
TEXT.Spanish: Brazil is strong in many ways, [CT_NAME]. Do not force me to show you how strong.

TEXT.English: You are outgunned and outclassed. I suggest you give me what I demand.
TEXT.French: Vous avez moins d'équipement que nous. Vous êtes surclassé. Je suggère que vous me donniez ce que je veux.
TEXT.German: Schlagt ein, wenn Ihr kein zweites Gettysburg erleben wollt!
TEXT.Italian: Dammi ci? che chiedo o proverai l'ira della nostra "terribile e rapida spada."
TEXT.Spanish: Dadnos esto o sentir?is la c?lera de nuestra "terrible y veloz espada".

TEXT.English: Can you spare this for the people of the [OUR_EMPIRE]?
TEXT.French: Pourriez-vous fournir ceci au peuple du [OUR_EMPIRE] ?
TEXT.German: Can you spare this for the people of the [OUR_EMPIRE]?
TEXT.Italian: Can you spare this for the people of the [OUR_EMPIRE]?
TEXT.Spanish: Can you spare this for the people of the [OUR_EMPIRE]?

TEXT.English: My people have faith in me, [CT_NAME]. Please help me not to disappoint them.
TEXT.French: Mon peuple a foi en moi, [CT_NAME]. Aidez-moi à ne pas le décevoir.
TEXT.German: My people have faith in me, [CT_NAME]. Please help me not to disappoint them.
TEXT.Italian: My people have faith in me, [CT_NAME]. Please help me not to disappoint them.
TEXT.Spanish: My people have faith in me, [CT_NAME]. Please help me not to disappoint them.

TEXT.English: The simplest strategy is for me to ask you for what we need and hope your good will wins out.
TEXT.French: La stratégie la plus simple pour moi est de vous demander de nous fournir ce dont nous avons besoin et espérer de la bonne volonté de votre part.
TEXT.German: Ihr werdet einem treuen Freund diese kleine Bitte doch nicht abschlagen, [CT_NAME]?
TEXT.Italian: Avresti un po' di questi in nome della nostra amicizia, [CT_NAME]?
TEXT.Spanish: ¿Podr?ais darles esto a unos buenos amigos, [CT_NAME]?

TEXT.English: Greetings, [CT_NAME]! I am [OUR_NAME], leader of the great civilization of [OUR_CIV_SHORT].
TEXT.French: Salutations, [CT_NAME]! Je suis [OUR_NAME], souverain de la grande civilisation de [OUR_CIV_SHORT].
TEXT.German: Seid gegrüßt, [CT_NAME]! Ich bin [OUR_NAME], Anführer der großen Zivilisation von [OUR_CIV_SHORT].
TEXT.Italian: Greetings, [CT_NAME]! I am [OUR_NAME], leader of the great civilization of [OUR_CIV_SHORT].
TEXT.Spanish: Greetings, [CT_NAME]! I am [OUR_NAME], leader of the great civilization of [OUR_CIV_SHORT].

TEXT.English: Peace be upon you, [CT_NAME] of [CT_CIV_SHORT]. If you would expect the blessings of Allah, be kind to his people, for Allah will help him who moves the ways of Allah.
TEXT.French: La paix soit sur vous, [CT_NAME] de [CT_CIV_SHORT]. Si vous attendez la bénédiction d'Allah, soyez bon avec son peuple, car Allah aidera celui qui suit la voie d'Allah.
TEXT.German: Friede sei mit Euch, [CT_NAME] von [CT_CIV_SHORT]. Falls Ihr die Segnungen Allahs erwartet, seid freundlich zu seinem Volk, denn Allah wird dem helfen, der die Wege Allahs bewegt.
TEXT.Italian: Peace be upon you, [CT_NAME] of [CT_CIV_SHORT]. If you would expect the blessings of Allah, be kind to his people, for Allah will help him who moves the ways of Allah.
TEXT.Spanish: Peace be upon you, [CT_NAME] of [CT_CIV_SHORT]. If you would expect the blessings of Allah, be kind to his people, for Allah will help him who moves the ways of Allah.

TEXT.English: I am [OUR_NAME], the President of the Turkish people. We Turks do not consider our principles as dogmas contained in books that are said to come from heaven. We derive our inspiration not from heaven, or from an unseen world, but directly from life.
TEXT.French: Je suis [OUR_NAME], président du peuple turc. Nous autres Turcs ne considérons pas nos principes comme des dogmes écrits dans des livres descendus du ciel. Nous tirons notre inspiration non pas du ciel, ni d'un monde invisible, mais directement de la vie.
TEXT.German: Seid gegrüßt, [CT_NAME]! Ich bin [OUR_NAME], Anführer der großen Zivilisation von [OUR_CIV_SHORT].
TEXT.Italian: I am [OUR_NAME], the President of the Turkish people. We Turks do not consider our principles as dogmas contained in books that are said to come from heaven. We derive our inspiration not from heaven, or from an unseen world, but directly from life.
TEXT.Spanish: I am [OUR_NAME], the President of the Turkish people. We Turks do not consider our principles as dogmas contained in books that are said to come from heaven. We derive our inspiration not from heaven, or from an unseen world, but directly from life.

TEXT.English: Hola. I am [OUR_NAME] of the [OUR_EMPIRE]. I am convinced that the good intentions of a ruler are simply not enough and that the collective factor represented by the workers is indispensable. Don't you agree [CT_NAME]?
TEXT.French: Hola. Je suis [OUR_NAME] du [OUR_EMPIRE]. Je suis convaincu que les bonnes intentions d'un souverain ne sont pas suffisantes et que le facteur collectif représenté par les travailleurs est indispensable. N'êtes-vous pas d'accord, [CT_NAME] ?
TEXT.German: Hola. I am [OUR_NAME] of the [OUR_EMPIRE]. I am convinced that the good intentions of a ruler are simply not enough and that the collective factor represented by the workers is indispensable. Don't you agree [CT_NAME]?
TEXT.Italian: Hola. I am [OUR_NAME] of the [OUR_EMPIRE]. I am convinced that the good intentions of a ruler are simply not enough and that the collective factor represented by the workers is indispensable. Don't you agree [CT_NAME]?
TEXT.Spanish: Hola. I am [OUR_NAME] of the [OUR_EMPIRE]. I am convinced that the good intentions of a ruler are simply not enough and that the collective factor represented by the workers is indispensable. Don't you agree [CT_NAME]?

TEXT.English: Welcome [CT_NAME]. We would welcome friendship with you. Are you greedy of territory, or greedy of piece and quiet?
TEXT.French: Bienvenue, [CT_NAME]. Nous nous lierons volontiers d'amitié avec vous. Êtes-vous avare de territoire, ou avare de paix et de tranquilité ?
TEXT.German: Willkommen, [CT_NAME]. Wir würden Freundschaft mit Euch willkommen heißen. Giert Ihr nach Eroberungen, oder nach Frieden und Ruhe?
TEXT.Italian: Welcome [CT_NAME]. We would welcome friendship with you. Are you greedy of territory, or greedy of piece and quiet?
TEXT.Spanish: Welcome [CT_NAME]. We would welcome friendship with you. Are you greedy of territory, or greedy of piece and quiet?

TEXT.English: Greetings in the name of God, [CT_NAME] of [CT_CIV_SHORT]. We are Emperor [OUR_NAME] of [OUR_CIV_SHORT]. We know that material and spiritual progress are essential to man. Will you join us as we ceaselessly work for the equal attainment of both?
TEXT.French: Au nom de Dieu, salut, [CT_NAME] de [CT_CIV_SHORT]. Nous sommes l'empereur [OUR_NAME] de l'[OUR_CIV_SHORT]. Nous savons que le progrès matériel et spirituel est essentiel à l'homme. Vous joindrez-vous à nous dans notre labeur incessant pour atteindre les deux ?
TEXT.German: Grüße im Namen Gottes, [CT_NAME] von [CT_CIV_SHORT]. Wir sind Kaiser [OUR_NAME] von [OUR_CIV_SHORT]. Wir wissen, dass körperlicher und spiritueller Fortschritt essentiell für den Menschen sind. Werdet Ihr daran teilhaben, wie wir ununterbrochen für das gleichzeitige Erlangen von beidem arbeiten?
TEXT.Italian: Greetings in the name of God, [CT_NAME] of [CT_CIV_SHORT]. We are Emperor [OUR_NAME] of [OUR_CIV_SHORT]. We know that material and spiritual progress are essential to man. Will you join us as we ceaselessly work for the equal attainment of both?
TEXT.Spanish: Greetings in the name of God, [CT_NAME] of [CT_CIV_SHORT]. We are Emperor [OUR_NAME] of [OUR_CIV_SHORT]. We know that material and spiritual progress are essential to man. Will you join us as we ceaselessly work for the equal attainment of both?

TEXT.English: Greetings, [CT_NAME]. My name is [OUR_NAME], and I am the president of [OUR_CIV_SHORT]. My motto is: when there is respect, there is peace!
TEXT.French: Salutations, [CT_NAME]. Je m'appelle [OUR_NAME], et je suis président du [OUR_CIV_SHORT]. Ma devise est la suivante : là où règne le respect règne la paix !
TEXT.German: Greetings, [CT_NAME]. My name is [OUR_NAME], and I am the president of [OUR_CIV_SHORT]. My motto is: when there is respect, there is peace!
TEXT.Italian: Greetings, [CT_NAME]. My name is [OUR_NAME], and I am the president of [OUR_CIV_SHORT]. My motto is: when there is respect, there is peace!
TEXT.Spanish: Greetings, [CT_NAME]. My name is [OUR_NAME], and I am the president of [OUR_CIV_SHORT]. My motto is: when there is respect, there is peace!

TEXT.English: I, [OUR_NAME] of the [OUR_EMPIRE], greet you. Know that those who speak of nationalism, democracy, and such things want to take our nation away from its mission.
TEXT.French: Moi, [OUR_NAME] du [OUR_EMPIRE], vous salue. Sachez que ceux qui parlent de nationalisme, de démocratie et d'autres choses du genre le font afin de détourner notre nation de sa mission.
TEXT.German: Ich, [OUR_NAME] von der [OUR_EMPIRE], grüße Euch. Wisset, dass jene, welche von Nationalismus, Demokratie und solchen Dingen sprechen, Eure Nation von ihrer Mission abbringen wollen.
TEXT.Italian: I, [OUR_NAME] of the [OUR_EMPIRE], greet you. Know that those who speak of nationalism, democracy, and such things want to take our nation away from its mission.
TEXT.Spanish: I, [OUR_NAME] of the [OUR_EMPIRE], greet you. Know that those who speak of nationalism, democracy, and such things want to take our nation away from its mission.

TEXT.English: Greetings. I am [OUR_NAME], Emperor of [OUR_CIV_SHORT]. Dedicating all my efforts to the well-being of my people, I shall guard the concept of Autocracy like all my forefathers did.
TEXT.French: Bonjour. Je suis [OUR_NAME], empereur de [OUR_CIV_SHORT]. Et dédiant tous mes efforts au bien-être de mon peuple, je défendrai l'idée de l'autocratie comme l'ont fait tous mes ancêtres.
TEXT.German: Grüße. Ich bin [OUR_NAME], Kaiser von [OUR_CIV_SHORT]. Während ich all meine Anstrengungen dem Wohlergehen meines Volkes widme, werde ich das Konzept der Autokratie beschützen wie alle meine Vorväter.
TEXT.Italian: Greetings. I am [OUR_NAME], Emperor of [OUR_CIV_SHORT]. Dedicating all my efforts to the well-being of my people, I shall guard the concept of Autocracy like all my forefathers did.
TEXT.Spanish: Greetings. I am [OUR_NAME], Emperor of [OUR_CIV_SHORT]. Dedicating all my efforts to the well-being of my people, I shall guard the concept of Autocracy like all my forefathers did.

TEXT.English: Welcome to humble [OUR_CIV_SHORT]. I am [OUR_NAME], leader of this far-reaching and ever progressing country. Tell me, who are you?
TEXT.French: Bienvenue dans l'humble [OUR_CIV_SHORT]. Je suis [OUR_NAME], souverain de ce grand pays en progrès constant. Dites-moi, qui êtes-vous ?
TEXT.German: Welcome to humble [OUR_CIV_SHORT]. I am [OUR_NAME], leader of this far-reaching and ever progressing country. Tell me, who are you?
TEXT.Italian: Welcome to humble [OUR_CIV_SHORT]. I am [OUR_NAME], leader of this far-reaching and ever progressing country. Tell me, who are you?
TEXT.Spanish: Welcome to humble [OUR_CIV_SHORT]. I am [OUR_NAME], leader of this far-reaching and ever progressing country. Tell me, who are you?

TEXT.English: Hello, friend. My name is [OUR_NAME], but you can call me Jose. Or you can call me Francisco. Or you can call me Martin. Just don't call me late for dinner.
TEXT.French: Bonjour, cher ami. Je m'appelle [OUR_NAME], mais vous pouvez m'appeler José. Ou Francisco. Ou Martín. Mais ne m'appelez pas en retard pour dîner.
TEXT.German: Hello, friend. My name is [OUR_NAME], but you can call me Jose. Or you can call me Francisco. Or you can call me Martin. Just don't call me late for dinner.
TEXT.Italian: Hello, friend. My name is [OUR_NAME], but you can call me Jose. Or you can call me Francisco. Or you can call me Martin. Just don't call me late for dinner.
TEXT.Spanish: Hello, friend. My name is [OUR_NAME], but you can call me Jose. Or you can call me Francisco. Or you can call me Martin. Just don't call me late for dinner.

TEXT.English: Hello, [CT_NAME]. I am General Santa Anna, Savior of Mexico! What have you come to offer me in tribute?
TEXT.French: Bonjour, [CT_NAME]. Je suis le général Santa Anna, sauveur du Mexique ! Que venez-vous m'offrir en tribut ?
TEXT.German: Hello, [CT_NAME]. I am General Santa Anna, Savior of Mexico! What have you come to offer me in tribute?
TEXT.Italian: Hello, [CT_NAME]. I am General Santa Anna, Savior of Mexico! What have you come to offer me in tribute?
TEXT.Spanish: Hello, [CT_NAME]. I am General Santa Anna, Savior of Mexico! What have you come to offer me in tribute?

TEXT.English: Greetings [CT_NAME]. I am [OUR_NAME], emperor of all the lands below the heavens. With absolute power over numberless minions, do you dare hurt the divine ruler of mighty [OUR_CIV_SHORT]?
TEXT.French: Salutations, [CT_NAME]. Je suis [OUR_NAME], empereur de toute la terre sous les cieux. D'innombrables serviteurs sont sous mon pouvoir absolu. Oserez-vous froisser le souverain divin de la puissante [OUR_CIV_SHORT] ?
TEXT.German: Greetings [CT_NAME]. I am [OUR_NAME], emperor of all the lands below the heavens. With absolute power over numberless minions, do you dare hurt the divine ruler of mighty [OUR_CIV_SHORT].
TEXT.Italian: Greetings [CT_NAME]. I am [OUR_NAME], emperor of all the lands below the heavens. With absolute power over numberless minions, do you dare hurt the divine ruler of mighty [OUR_CIV_SHORT].
TEXT.Spanish: Greetings [CT_NAME]. I am [OUR_NAME], emperor of all the lands below the heavens. With absolute power over numberless minions, do you dare hurt the divine ruler of mighty [OUR_CIV_SHORT].

TEXT.English: [OUR_NAME] of [OUR_CIV_SHORT] greets you. I do not praise myself or my courage, but I praise God, for he protected me, a sinful man, from deadly dangers and created me capable of doing many human things.
TEXT.French: [OUR_NAME] de [OUR_CIV_SHORT] vous salue. Je ne loue pas mon propre courage, mais je loue Dieu, qui m'a protégé, pécheur que je suis, de périls mortels et qui m'a rendu capable d'accomplir de nombreuses choses.
TEXT.German: [OUR_NAME] von [OUR_CIV_SHORT] grüßt Euch. Ich lobe weder mich selbst noch meinen Mut, aber ich lobe Gott, denn er beschützte mich, einen sündigen Mann, vor tödlichen Gefahren und ermöglichte mir, viele menschliche Dinge zu tun.
TEXT.Italian: [OUR_NAME] of [OUR_CIV_SHORT] greets you. I do not praise myself or my courage, but I praise God, for he protected me, a sinful man, from deadly dangers and created me capable of doing many human things.
TEXT.Spanish: [OUR_NAME] of [OUR_CIV_SHORT] greets you. I do not praise myself or my courage, but I praise God, for he protected me, a sinful man, from deadly dangers and created me capable of doing many human things.

TEXT.English: We must get ready to build up the friendship between our peoples. How does a people get prepared for such an endeavour? By strengthening the natural bridges that exist between us. Language is a bridge... Religion is a bridge... History is a bridge...
TEXT.French: Nous devons nous préparer à bâtir une amitié entre nos peuples. Comment un peuple se prépare-t-il pour une telle chose ? En renforçant les ponts naturels qui existent entre nous. La langue est un pont... La religion est un pont... L'histoire est un pont...
TEXT.German: Wir müssen uns bereit machen, die Freundschaft zwischen unseren Völkern aufzubauen. Wie wird ein Volk auf solch ein Vorhaben vorbereitet? Indem wir die natürlichen Brücken stärken, die zwischen uns existieren. Sprache ist eine Brücke ... Religion ist eine Brücke ... Geschichte ist eine Brücke ...
TEXT.Italian: We must get ready to build up the friendship between our peoples. How does a people get prepared for such an endeavour? By strengthening the natural bridges that exist between us. Language is a bridge... Religon is a bridge... History is a bridge...
TEXT.Spanish: We must get ready to build up the friendship between our peoples. How does a people get prepared for such an endeavour? By strengthening the natural bridges that exist between us. Language is a bridge... Religon is a bridge... History is a bridge...

TEXT.English: Welcome, [CT_NAME]. Imagination, devotion, perseverance, together with divine grace, will assure your success. What shall we discuss?
TEXT.French: Bienvenue, [CT_NAME]. Imagination, dévouement et persévérance, avec la grâce divine, assureront votre succès. De quoi voulez-vous discuter ?
TEXT.German: Willkommen, [CT_NAME]. Vorstellungskraft, Hingabe, Durchhaltevermögen, zusammen mit Gottes Gnade, wird Euren Erfolg sichern. Was sollen wir besprechen?
TEXT.Italian: Welcome, [CT_NAME]. Imagination, devotion, perseverance, together with divine grace, will assure your success. What shall we discuss?
TEXT.Spanish: Welcome, [CT_NAME]. Imagination, devotion, perseverance, together with divine grace, will assure your success. What shall we discuss?

TEXT.English: Greetings, [CT_NAME]! It is so great to be at peace with you glorious nation!
TEXT.French: Salutations, [CT_NAME] ! Qu'il est bon d'être en paix avec votre glorieuse nation !
TEXT.German: Greetings, [CT_NAME]! It is so great to be at peace with you glorious nation!
TEXT.Italian: Greetings, [CT_NAME]! It is so great to be at peace with you glorious nation!
TEXT.Spanish: Greetings, [CT_NAME]! It is so great to be at peace with you glorious nation!

TEXT.English: I see you have come to visit, [CT_NAME]. Tell me what is it you wish to discuss.
TEXT.French: Je constate que vous êtes venu nous visiter, [CT_NAME]. Dites-moi de quoi vous voulez discuter.
TEXT.German: I see you have come to visit, [CT_NAME]. Tell me, what is it you wish to discuss.
TEXT.Italian: I see you have come to visit, [CT_NAME]. Tell me, what is it you wish to discuss.
TEXT.Spanish: I see you have come to visit, [CT_NAME]. Tell me, what is it you wish to discuss.

TEXT.English: Finally I get to talk to a worthy adversary. What can the [OUR_EMPIRE] do for you?
TEXT.French: Enfin, je parle à un adversaire digne de ce nom. Qu'est-ce que la [OUR_EMPIRE] peut faire pour vous ?
TEXT.German: Seid gegr??t, [CT_NAME]. Nehmt Platz und lasst uns ein wenig plaudern.
TEXT.Italian: Salve, [CT_NAME]. Siediti e parliamo per un po'.
TEXT.Spanish: Saludos, [CT_NAME]. Sentaos y charlemos un rato.

TEXT.English: The world is well supplied with people who wish to rule and dominate others. People like you.
TEXT.French: Le monde est rempli de gens qui veulent régner et dominer les autres. Des gens comme vous.
TEXT.German: Die Welt ist gut versorgt mit Menschen, die andere beherrschen und dominieren wollen. Menschen wie Euch.
TEXT.Italian: The world is well supplied with people who wish to rule and dominate others. People like you.
TEXT.Spanish: The world is well supplied with people who wish to rule and dominate others. People like you.

TEXT.English: Oh, you again... What are you going to complain about?
TEXT.French: Oh, encore vous... De quoi êtes-vous venu vous plaindre ?
TEXT.German: Oh, you again... What are you going to complain about?
TEXT.Italian: Oh, you again... What are you going to complain about?
TEXT.Spanish: Oh, you again... What are you going to complain about?

TEXT.English: If one permits an infidel to continue in his role as a corrupter of the earth, the infidel's moral suffering will be all the worse. If one kills the infidel, and this stops him from perpetrating his misdeeds, his death will be a blessing to him.
TEXT.French: Si l'on permet à un infidèle de continuer à corrompre la Terre, la souffrance morale de l'infidèle n'en sera que renforcée. Si l'on tue l'infidèle, et que cela met fin à ses méfaits, sa mort sera pour lui une bénédiction.
TEXT.German: Wenn man einem Ungläubigen erlaubt, seine Rolle als Verderber der Erde fortzusetzen, wird das moralische Leiden des Ungläubigen umso größer sein. Wenn man den Ungläubigen tötet, und ihn vom Fortsetzen seiner Untaten abhält, wird ihm sein Tod ein Segen sein.
TEXT.Italian: If one permits an infidel to continue in his role as a corrupter of the earth, the infidel's moral suffering will be all the worse. If one kills the infidel, and this stops him from perpetrating his misdeeds, his death will be a blessing to him.
TEXT.Spanish: If one permits an infidel to continue in his role as a corrupter of the earth, the infidel's moral suffering will be all the worse. If one kills the infidel, and this stops him from perpetrating his misdeeds, his death will be a blessing to him.

TEXT.English: Treachery, cowardice and lies are everywhere - and your nation is no exception.
TEXT.French: La traîtrise, la lâcheté et les mensonges sont partout - et votre nation ne fait pas exception.
TEXT.German: Verrat, Feigheit und Lügen sind überall - und Eure Nation ist keine Ausnahme.
TEXT.Italian: Treachery, cowardice and lies are everywhere - and your nation is no exception.
TEXT.Spanish: Treachery, cowardice and lies are everywhere - and your nation is no exception.

TEXT.English: Speak fast [CT_CIV_ADJ]. I have enough on my schedule already.
TEXT.French: Parlez vite, [CT_CIV_ADJ]. Mon horaire est déjà assez rempli.
TEXT.German: Speak fast [CT_CIV_ADJ]. I have enough on my schedule already.
TEXT.Italian: Speak fast [CT_CIV_ADJ]. I have enough on my schedule already.
TEXT.Spanish: Speak fast [CT_CIV_ADJ]. I have enough on my schedule already.

TEXT.English: You lack the guile to trick me. Be warned I will not react well to deceit.
TEXT.French: Vous n'êtes pas assez rusé pour me tromper. Soyez averti que je ne réagirai pas favorablement si vous essayez.
TEXT.German: Was verschafft mir die zweifelhafte Ehre Eures Besuchs?
TEXT.Italian: E a cosa devo il dubbio onore della tua presenza?
TEXT.Spanish: ¿Y a qu? debemos el dudoso honor de vuestra compa??a?

TEXT.English: The government of the [OUR_EMPIRE] will fulfill its duty to defend its independence and to repel foreign aggression, and accept the struggle to which it has been provoked!
TEXT.French: Le gouvernement du [OUR_EMPIRE] accomplira son devoir de défendre son indépendance et de repousser toute agression, et accepte de lutter en réponse à la provocation !
TEXT.German: The government of the [OUR_EMPIRE] will fulfill its duty to defend its independence, to repel foreign aggression, and accept the struggle to which it has been provoked!
TEXT.Italian: The government of the [OUR_EMPIRE] will fulfill its duty to defend its independence, to repel foreign aggression, and accept the struggle to which it has been provoked!
TEXT.Spanish: The government of the [OUR_EMPIRE] will fulfill its duty to defend its independence, to repel foreign aggression, and accept the struggle to which it has been provoked!

TEXT.English: No way! I shall punish you for your crimes against [OUR_CIV_SHORT] and its people!
TEXT.French: Jamais ! Je vous punirai pour vos crimes contre le [OUR_CIV_SHORT] et son peuple !
TEXT.German: No way! I shall punish you for your crimes against [OUR_CIV_SHORT] and its people!
TEXT.Italian: No way! I shall punish you for your crimes against [OUR_CIV_SHORT] and its people!
TEXT.Spanish: No way! I shall punish you for your crimes against [OUR_CIV_SHORT] and its people!

TEXT.English: I knew you would beg for peace eventually, but there will be no peace until you surrender.
TEXT.French: Je savais que vous finiriez par nous supplier de faire la paix, mais il n'y aura pas de paix avant votre reddition.
TEXT.German: Wie ein Freund von mir zu sagen pflegte: 'Ich akzeptiere nur die sofortige und bedingungslose Kapitulation'. ?u?erst treffend, nicht wahr?
TEXT.Italian: Come disse una volta un mio amico: "L'unica cosa accettabile ? una resa incondizionata e immediata." Conciso, non trovi?
TEXT.Spanish: Como un amigo m?o dijo una vez: "Ninguna condici?n es aceptable, salvo una rendici?n incondicional e inmediata". Es una l?stima, ¿no cre?is?

TEXT.English: Get out of my office!
TEXT.French: Sortez de mon bureau !
TEXT.German: Get out of my office!
TEXT.Italian: Get out of my office!
TEXT.Spanish: Get out of my office!

TEXT.English: You make me sad, [CT_NAME]. Go away.
TEXT.French: Vous m'attristez, [CT_NAME]. Partez.
TEXT.German: You make me sad, [CT_NAME]. Go away.
TEXT.Italian: You make me sad, [CT_NAME]. Go away.
TEXT.Spanish: You make me sad, [CT_NAME]. Go away.

TEXT.English: I will now use my cunning knowledge of tactics to ignore you.
TEXT.French: Permettez-moi d'user de mes grandes compétences tactiques afin de vous ignorer.
TEXT.German: Fahrt zur H?lle!
TEXT.Italian: Sparisci.
TEXT.Spanish: Pod?is iros al cuerno.

TEXT.English: Your words are but the grunts of a diseased pig, [CT_NAME]. I do not hear them.
TEXT.French: Vos paroles sonnent à mes oreilles tels les horribles grognements d'un porc agonisant, [CT_NAME]. Je ne les écouterai pas plus longtemps.
TEXT.German: Ihr sprecht mit gespaltener Zunge, [CT_NAME], und ich will es nicht hören!
TEXT.Italian: Le tue parole risuonano come i grugniti di un maiale morente, [CT_NAME]. Un rumore fastidioso che non voglio udire.
TEXT.Spanish: Vuestras palabras no son más que gruñidos de un cerdo enfermo, [CT_NAME]. Como tales, no las escucho.

TEXT.English: Give me this, [CT_NAME] and perhaps our two nations can live in peace for a while longer.
TEXT.French: Donnez-moi ce que je demande, [CT_NAME], et peut-être nos deux nations pourront-elles cohabiter en paix quelque temps encore.
TEXT.German: Gebt uns, was wir verlangen, [CT_NAME], dann besteht die Chance, dass unsere Zivilisationen noch eine Weile in Frieden miteinander leben!
TEXT.Italian: Dammi questo, [CT_NAME], e forse le nostre due nazioni vivranno in pace per un altro po'.
TEXT.Spanish: Dadme esto, [CT_NAME], y es posible que nuestras naciones puedan vivir en paz un poco más.

TEXT.English: Hand this over, [CT_NAME], and I might let you continue to exist for a short while longer.
TEXT.French: Donnez-nous ce tribut, [CT_NAME], et il est possible que je vous laisse vivre... quelque temps, en tout cas.
TEXT.German: Her damit, [CT_NAME]! Dann werde ich Euch vielleicht noch eine Weile verschonen!
TEXT.Italian: Dammelo, [CT_NAME], e potrei lasciarti continuare a esistere ancora un po'.
TEXT.Spanish: Entregadnos esto, [CT_NAME] y puede que os deje perdurar un poco más.

TEXT.English: Unlikely as it may seem, it appears that your puny civilization has something that we want. I suggest you hand it over quickly.
TEXT.French: Aussi ahurissant que cela puisse paraître, il semblerait que votre ridicule petite civilisation dispose de quelque chose qui pourrait nous être utile. Je vous suggère de nous le délivrer au plus vite.
TEXT.German: So unglaublich es auch klingen mag: Eure mickrige Zivilisation scheint tatsächlich etwas zu haben, was wir wollen. Ihr wärt gut beraten, es uns schnellstens zu überlassen!
TEXT.Italian: Per quanto possa apparire improbabile, a quanto pare la tua insignificante civiltà possiede qualcosa che vogliamo. Ti consiglio di darcelo subito.
TEXT.Spanish: Por extraño que suene, parece que vuestra civilización tiene algo que queremos. Os sugiero que nos lo deis rápidamente.

TEXT.English: Welcome, [CT_NAME]. And how is that undefended civilization of yours coming along?
TEXT.French: Bienvenue, [CT_NAME]. Alors, comment évolue donc la situation dans votre petite civilisation si vulnérable ?
TEXT.German: Willkommen, [CT_NAME]! Und, wie stehen die Dinge in Eurer hilflosen kleinen Zivilisation?
TEXT.Italian: Salve, [CT_NAME]. Come vanno le cose per la tua civiltà indifesa?
TEXT.Spanish: Saludos, [CT_NAME]. ¿Cómo está esa civilización indefensa de la que venís?

TEXT.English: Not a chance. The mighty [OUR_CIV_ADJ] people do not care to make peace with cattle-stealing brigands like you.
TEXT.French: N'y comptez pas ! Le puissant peuple des [OUR_CIV_ADJ] ne souhaite pas faire la paix avec des vils voleurs de bétail de votre espèce.
TEXT.German: Keine Chance! Das mächtige [OUR_CIV_ADJ:3] Volk hat kein Interesse daran, mit miesen Viehdieben wie Euch Frieden zu schließen!
TEXT.Italian: Neanche per idea. Al potente sovrano [OUR_CIV_ADJ] non può interessare la pace con briganti ladri di bestiame come voi.
TEXT.Spanish: Ni en broma. El poderoso pueblo [OUR_CIV_ADJ:1] no se molesta ni en hacer las paces con cuatreros bergantes como vosotros.

TEXT.English: Greetings, [CT_NAME]! The [OUR_CIV_ADJ] people always enjoy meeting vulnerable and undefended new civilizations!
TEXT.French: Mes hommages, [CT_NAME] ! Le peuple des [OUR_CIV_ADJ] est toujours enchanté de rencontrer de nouvelles civilisations vulnérables et sans défense !
TEXT.German: Seid gegrüßt, [CT_NAME]! Das [OUR_CIV_ADJ:3] Volk ist stets hoch erfreut, die Bekanntschaft schutz- und wehrloser neuer Zivilisationen zu machen!
TEXT.Italian: Salve, [CT_NAME]! Il sovrano [OUR_CIV_ADJ] è sempre lieto di incontrare nuove civiltà vulnerabili e indifese!
TEXT.Spanish: ¡Saludos, [CT_NAME]! El pueblo [OUR_CIV_ADJ:1] siempre se congratula de encontrarse con civilizaciones vulnerables e indefensas.

TEXT.English: So you have emerged from your fetid country and come to me, [CT_NAME]. To what do I owe this extremely dubious honor?
TEXT.French: Vous avez enfin réussi à sortir de cet horrible pays pour venir me voir, [CT_NAME]. Que me vaut un pareil honneur ?
TEXT.German: Oha, Ihr habt Euer stinkendes Land verlassen, um mich zu besuchen, [CT_NAME]? Was verschafft mir denn diese zweifelhafte Ehre?
TEXT.Italian: E così hai lasciato quel tuo fetido paese e sei venuto da me, [CT_NAME]. E a cosa devo questo dubbio onore?
TEXT.Spanish: Así que habéis salido de vuestro fétido país y habéis venido a verme, [CT_NAME]. ¿A qué debo tan dudoso honor?

TEXT.English: We require mighty [CT_CIV_SHORT]'s assistance. I hope you won't disappoint us.
TEXT.French: Nous avons besoin de l'aide du [CT_CIV_SHORT]. J'espère que vous ne nous décevrez pas.
TEXT.German: Wir könnten die Hilfe des mächtigen Volkes von [CT_CIV_SHORT] brauchen und hoffen doch sehr, dass Ihr uns nicht im Stich lasst!
TEXT.Italian: Chiediamo aiuto alla tua potente civiltà. Spero che non ci deluderai.
TEXT.Spanish: Necesitamos la ayuda y la fortaleza de [CT_CIV]. Espero que no nos decepcionéis.

TEXT.English: A Mutual Protection Pact - Each Party Agrees to Automatically Declare War if the Other Party is Attacked.
TEXT.French: Pacte d'assistance mutuelle : chaque partie accepte de déclarer automatiquement la guerre si l'autre est attaquée.
TEXT.German: Ein Verteidigungsbündnis - Beide Parteien stimmen zu, den Angreifern der anderen Partei automatisch den Krieg zu erklären.
TEXT.Italian: Un patto di protezione reciproca: ogni civiltà accetta di dichiarare automaticamente guerra se la civiltà alleata viene attaccata.
TEXT.Spanish: Un acuerdo de protección mutua: cada parte accede a declarar automáticamente la guerra si alguien ataca a la otra.

TEXT.English: Slave Trade
TEXT.French: Commerce des esclaves
TEXT.German: Sklavenhandel
TEXT.Italian: Slave Trade
TEXT.Spanish: Slave Trade

TEXT.English: Good day and bonjour to you, [CT_NAME]. The [OUR_CIV_ADJ] people wish for peace, but insists that masters in our own house we must be.
TEXT.French: Bonjour et good day, [CT_NAME]. Le peuple [OUR_CIV_ADJ] souhaite la paix, mais nous insistons pour être maîtres chez nous.
TEXT.German: Good day and bonjour, to you [CT_NAME]. The [OUR_CIV_ADJ] people wish for peace, but insist that masters in our own house we must be.
TEXT.Italian: Good day and bonjour, to you [CT_NAME]. The [OUR_CIV_ADJ] people wish for peace, but insist that masters in our own house we must be.
TEXT.Spanish: Good day and bonjour, to you [CT_NAME]. The [OUR_CIV_ADJ] people wish for peace, but insist that masters in our own house we must be.

TEXT.English: Finally we meet [CT_NAME], I have been awaiting your arrival. I am Meiji of Japan. Come, we have much to discuss. You have very nice dress, and I am impressed by your armies. Please, show me your ways and I shall show you the wonders of Japan...
TEXT.French: Nous nous rencontrons enfin, [CT_NAME]. J'attendais votre arrivée. Je suis Meiji du Japon. Venez, discutons. Vos habits sont très beaux, vos armées m'impresionnent. Montrez-moi vos coutumes, et je vous montrerai les merveilles du Japon...
TEXT.German: Finally we meet [CT_NAME], I have been awaiting your arrival. I am Meiji of Japan. Come, we have much to discuss. You have very nice dress, and I am impressed by your armies. Please, show me your ways and I shall show you the wonders of Japan...
TEXT.Italian: Finally we meet [CT_NAME], I have been awaiting your arrival. I am Meiji of Japan. Come, we have much to discuss. You have very nice dress, and I am impressed by your armies. Please, show me your ways and I shall show you the wonders of Japan...
TEXT.Spanish: Finally we meet [CT_NAME], I have been awaiting your arrival. I am Meiji of Japan. Come, we have much to discuss. You have very nice dress, and I am impressed by your armies. Please, show me your ways and I shall show you the wonders of Japan...

TEXT.English: Welcome to the independent [OUR_CIV_ADJ] lands! I am the king [OUR_NAME], will [CT_CIV_SHORT] recognize [OUR_CIV_SHORT]'s independence or do I need to convince you with my armies?
TEXT.French: Bienvenue dans les terres indépendantes du [OUR_CIV_SHORT] ! Je suis le roi [OUR_NAME]. Le [CT_CIV_SHORT] reconnaîtra-t-il l'indépendance [OUR_CIV_ADJ] ou dois-je vous en convaincre à l'aide de mes armées !
TEXT.German: Seid gegr??t, [CT_NAME]. Mein Name ist [OUR_NAME]. Es ist mir eine Ehre, Eure Bekanntschaft zu machen.
TEXT.Italian: Saluti, [CT_NAME]. Sono [OUR_NAME]. ? davvero un onore incontrarti.
TEXT.Spanish: Saludos, [CT_NAME]. Soy [OUR_NAME]. Es todo un honor conoceros.

TEXT.English: Here comes my best friend, [CT_NAME]! What brings you today to [OUR_CIV_SHORT]?
TEXT.French: Voici mon bon ami [CT_NAME]! Qu'est-ce qui vous amène au [OUR_CIV_SHORT] ?
TEXT.German: Seid gegr??t, [CT_NAME]. Nehmt Platz und lasst uns ein wenig plaudern.
TEXT.Italian: Salve, [CT_NAME]. Siediti e parliamo per un po'.
TEXT.Spanish: Saludos, [CT_NAME]. Sentaos y charlemos un rato.

TEXT.English: You are an enemy of [OUR_CIV_SHORT], but I will talk to you.
TEXT.French: Vous êtes un ennemi du [OUR_CIV_SHORT], mais j'accepte de vous parler.
TEXT.German: Was verschafft mir die zweifelhafte Ehre Eures Besuchs?
TEXT.Italian: E a cosa devo il dubbio onore della tua presenza?
TEXT.Spanish: ¿Y a qu? debemos el dudoso honor de vuestra compa??a?

TEXT.English: We desperatedly demand your assistance, [CT_NAME]! [OUR_CIV_SHORT]'s future depends on you!
TEXT.French: Nous avons désespérément besoin de votre aide, [CT_NAME] ! Le futur du [OUR_CIV_SHORT] dépend de vous !
TEXT.German: Ihr werdet einem treuen Freund diese kleine Bitte doch nicht abschlagen, [CT_NAME]?
TEXT.Italian: Avresti un po' di questi in nome della nostra amicizia, [CT_NAME]?
TEXT.Spanish: ¿Podr?ais darles esto a unos buenos amigos, [CT_NAME]?

TEXT.English: Any chance you share your wealth with [OUR_CIV_SHORT]?
TEXT.French: Y a-t-il une chance que vous partagiez votre richesse avec le [OUR_CIV_SHORT] ?
TEXT.German: Helfen hei?t br?derlich teilen, [CT_NAME].
TEXT.Italian: Se ci tieni a me, condividi, [CT_NAME].
TEXT.Spanish: Compartir es de generosos, [CT_NAME].

TEXT.English: Recognizing me as king of the [OUR_EMPIRE] is not enough! I demand the following in tribute!
TEXT.French: Me reconnaître comme roi du [OUR_EMPIRE] est insuffisant ! J'exige le tribut suivant !
TEXT.German: Schlagt ein, wenn Ihr kein zweites Gettysburg erleben wollt!
TEXT.Italian: Dammi ci? che chiedo o proverai l'ira della nostra "terribile e rapida spada."
TEXT.Spanish: Dadnos esto o sentir?is la c?lera de nuestra "terrible y veloz espada".

TEXT.English: Welcome to our grand city, [CT_NAME]. They call me Atlatl Cauac, or, in your language, Spearthrower Owl. Please join me atop one of our pyramids, the view of the valley is magnificent...
TEXT.French: Bienvenue dans notre cité, [CT_NAME]. On m'appelle Atlatl Cauac. Je vous en prie, accompagnez-moi au sommet d'une de nos pyramides : la vue de la vallée est magnifique...
TEXT.German: Welcome to our grand city, [CT_NAME]. They call me Atlatl Cauac, or, in your language, Spearthrower Owl. Please join me atop one of our pyramids, the view of the valley is magnificent...
TEXT.Italian: Welcome to our grand city, [CT_NAME]. They call me Atlatl Cauac, or, in your language, Spearthrower Owl. Please join me atop one of our pyramids, the view of the valley is magnificent...
TEXT.Spanish: Welcome to our grand city, [CT_NAME]. They call me Atlatl Cauac, or, in your language, Spearthrower Owl. Please join me atop one of our pyramids, the view of the valley is magnificent...

TEXT.English: Welcome to the Olmec heartland, [CT_NAME]. I am Tezcatlipoca, god-ruler of these lands. Shall I order my men to carve your likeness in stone?
TEXT.French: Bienvenue dans la patrie des Olmèques, [CT_NAME]. Moi, Tezcatlipoca, règne sur ces terres. Dois-je ordonner à mes hommes de sculpter votre portrait dans la pierre ?
TEXT.German: Welcome to the Olmec heartland, [CT_NAME]. I am Tezcatlipoca, god-ruler of these lands. Shall I order my men to carve your likeness in stone?
TEXT.Italian: Welcome to the Olmec heartland, [CT_NAME]. I am Tezcatlipoca, god-ruler of these lands. Shall I order my men to carve your likeness in stone?
TEXT.Spanish: Welcome to the Olmec heartland, [CT_NAME]. I am Tezcatlipoca, god-ruler of these lands. Shall I order my men to carve your likeness in stone?

TEXT.English: Shalom, [CT_NAME]. Let us hope you bring with you peaceful relations, for aggression against [OUR_CIV_SHORT] will be answered with equal or greater force.
TEXT.French: Shalom, [CT_NAME]. Souhaitons que vos intentions soient paisibles, car toute agression contre [OUR_CIV_SHORT] recevra une réponse de force égale ou supérieure.
TEXT.German: Shalom, [CT_NAME]. Let us hope you bring with you peaceful relations, for aggression against [OUR_CIV_SHORT] will be answered with equal or greater force.
TEXT.Italian: Shalom, [CT_NAME]. Let us hope you bring with you peaceful relations, for aggression against [OUR_CIV_SHORT] will be answered with equal or greater force.
TEXT.Spanish: Shalom, [CT_NAME]. Let us hope you bring with you peaceful relations, for aggression against [OUR_CIV_SHORT] will be answered with equal or greater force.

TEXT.English: The most dangerous enemy to the security of [OUR_CIV_SHORT] is the intellectual inertia of those who are responsible for security. As it stands, I'm the minister of defense, and I can't let you fool me.
TEXT.French: L'ennemi le plus dangereux pour la sécurité d'[OUR_CIV_SHORT] est l'inertie intellectuelle de ceux qui sont responsables de la sécurité. En tant que ministre de la défense, je ne peux vous laisser me berner.
TEXT.German: The most dangerous enemy to the security of [OUR_CIV_SHORT] is the intellectual inertia of those who are responsible for security. As it stands, I'm the minister of defense, and I can't let you fool me.
TEXT.Italian: The most dangerous enemy to the security of [OUR_CIV_SHORT] is the intellectual inertia of those who are responsible for security. As it stands, I'm the minister of defense, and I can't let you fool me.
TEXT.Spanish: The most dangerous enemy to the security of [OUR_CIV_SHORT] is the intellectual inertia of those who are responsible for security. As it stands, I'm the minister of defense, and I can't let you fool me.

TEXT.English: When faced with a situation that necessitates an armed solution, our national doctrine dictates that we don't sit around like lambs for slaughter. You [CT_CIV_ADJ:1] brought this upon yourselves. ([OUR_NAME] declares war!)
TEXT.French: Face à toute situation nécessitant une solution armée, notre doctrine nationale nous interdit de nous laisser mener comme des agneaux à l'abattoir. Vous autres [CT_CIV_ADJ:1] saviez ce qui vous attendait. ([OUR_NAME] vous déclare la guerre !)
TEXT.German: When faced with a situation that necessitates an armed solution, our national doctrine dictates that we don't sit around like lambs for slaughter. You [CT_CIV_ADJ:1] brought this upon yourselves. ([OUR_NAME] declares war!)
TEXT.Italian: When faced with a situation that necessitates an armed solution, our national doctrine dictates that we don't sit around like lambs for slaughter. You [CT_CIV_ADJ:1] brought this upon yourselves. ([OUR_NAME] declares war!)
TEXT.Spanish: When faced with a situation that necessitates an armed solution, our national doctrine dictates that we don't sit around like lambs for slaughter. You [CT_CIV_ADJ:1] brought this upon yourselves. ([OUR_NAME] declares war!)

TEXT.English: What matters is not what the goyim say, but what the [OUR_CIV_ADJ:1] do. Unless we make a stand here and show the world that there is a high a price for murdering our brothers and sisters, we won't survive.
TEXT.French: L'important n'est pas ce que disent les Gentils, mais ce que font les [OUR_CIV_ADJ:1]. Si nous ne nous défendons pas et ne montrons pas au monde le prix à payer pour tuer nos frères et no sœurs, nous ne survivrons pas.
TEXT.German: What matters is not what the goyim say, but what the [OUR_CIV_ADJ:1] do. Unless we make a stand here and show the world that there is a high a price for murdering our brothers and sisters, we won't survive.
TEXT.Italian: What matters is not what the goyim say, but what the [OUR_CIV_ADJ:1] do. Unless we make a stand here and show the world that there is a high a price for murdering our brothers and sisters, we won't survive.
TEXT.Spanish: What matters is not what the goyim say, but what the [OUR_CIV_ADJ:1] do. Unless we make a stand here and show the world that there is a high a price for murdering our brothers and sisters, we won't survive.

TEXT.English: Glad to have you back, [CT_NAME]. Your continued support for the state of [OUR_CIV_SHORT] will be appreciated for generations to come.
TEXT.French: Content de vous revoir, [CT_NAME]. Votre soutien continuel à l'État d'[OUR_CIV_SHORT] sera apprécié par les générations à venir.
TEXT.German: Glad to have you back, [CT_NAME]. Your continued support for the state of [OUR_CIV_SHORT] will be appreciated for generations to come.
TEXT.Italian: Glad to have you back, [CT_NAME]. Your continued support for the state of [OUR_CIV_SHORT] will be appreciated for generations to come.
TEXT.English: Glad to have you back, [CT_NAME]. Your continued support for the state of [OUR_CIV_SHORT] will be appreciated for generations to come.

When we put forth the motion to form the state of [OUR_CIV_SHORT], we thought we would no longer have to put up with the politics of people like you... yet here you are. I'm listening, [CT_NAME], but with strained ears.
TEXT.French: Quand nous avons enclenché le mouvement pour former l'État d'[OUR_CIV_SHORT], nous pensions ne plus avoir à s'occuper de politique avec des gens comme vous... et pourtant vous êtes là. J'écoute, [CT_NAME], mais mes oreilles sont fatiguées.
TEXT.German: When we put forth the motion to form the state of [OUR_CIV_SHORT], we thought we would no longer have to put up with the politics of people like you... yet here you are. I'm listening, [CT_NAME], but with strained ears.
TEXT.Italian: When we put forth the motion to form the state of [OUR_CIV_SHORT], we thought we would no longer have to put up with the politics of people like you... yet here you are. I'm listening, [CT_NAME], but with strained ears.
TEXT.Spanish: When we put forth the motion to form the state of [OUR_CIV_SHORT], we thought we would no longer have to put up with the politics of people like you... yet here you are. I'm listening, [CT_NAME], but with strained ears.

TEXT.English: Ideally the national estate of [OUR_CIV_SHORT] should be created through our own labor alone, but when afflicted with reality's setbacks, we have no choice but to bend our principles a little. Care to help?
TEXT.French: Dans un monde idéal, les biens nationaux d'[OUR_CIV_SHORT] devraient être créées par notre labeur seul, mais lorsque la réalité nous inflige des revers, nous devons quelque peu délaisser nos principes. Pourriez-vous nous aider ?
TEXT.German: Ideally the national estate of [OUR_CIV_SHORT] should be created through our own labor alone, but when afflicted with reality's setbacks, we have no choice but to bend our principles a little. Care to help?
TEXT.Italian: Ideally the national estate of [OUR_CIV_SHORT] should be created through our own labor alone, but when afflicted with reality's setbacks, we have no choice but to bend our principles a little. Care to help?
TEXT.Spanish: Ideally the national estate of [OUR_CIV_SHORT] should be created through our own labor alone, but when afflicted with reality's setbacks, we have no choice but to bend our principles a little. Care to help?

TEXT.English: Children of [OUR_CIV_SHORT] are in need of new settlements. Prove yourself our friend, or you will know the backs of our guns.
TEXT.French: Les enfants d'[OUR_CIV_SHORT] ont besoin de nouvelles colonies. Montrez que vous êtes notre ami, ou vous tâterez de nos fusils.
TEXT.German: Children of [OUR_CIV_SHORT] are in need of new settlements. Prove yourself our friend, or you will know the backs of our guns.
TEXT.Italian: Children of [OUR_CIV_SHORT] are in need of new settlements. Prove yourself our friend, or you will know the backs of our guns.
TEXT.Spanish: Children of [OUR_CIV_SHORT] are in need of new settlements. Prove yourself our friend, or you will know the backs of our guns.

TEXT.English: We [OUR_CIV_ADJ:1] are a people of peerless zeal. Should you evoke our wrath, we would plunge you into a vortex worthy of the end times. Instead, let's see that it needn't come to that.
TEXT.French: Nous autres [OUR_CIV_ADJ:1] sommes un peuple au zèle hors pair. Si vous suscitez notre colère, nous vous plongerons dans un vortex digne de la fin des temps. Évitons ensemble d'en arriver là.
TEXT.German: We [OUR_CIV_ADJ:1] are a people of peerless zeal. Should you evoke our wrath, we would plunge you into a vortex worthy of the end times. Instead, let's see that it needn't come to that.
TEXT.Italian: We [OUR_CIV_ADJ:1] are a people of peerless zeal. Should you evoke our wrath, we would plunge you into a vortex worthy of the end times. Instead, let's see that it needn't come to that.
TEXT.Spanish: We [OUR_CIV_ADJ:1] are a people of peerless zeal. Should you evoke our wrath, we would plunge you into a vortex worthy of the end times. Instead, let's see that it needn't come to that.

TEXT.English: I, Qaghan Bumin, was called slave, but I am free. And by rights of sharp swords the son of free men, forging the strength of my people to ride under the sky of Tengri.
TEXT.French: Moi, Bumin Qaghan, fus jadis un esclave, mais suis désormais libre. Fils des hommes libres par la loi de l'épée, je forge la puissance de mon peuple chevauchant sous le ciel de Tengri.
TEXT.German: I, Qaghan Bumin, was called slave, but I am free. And by rights of sharp swords the son of free men, forging the strength of my people to ride under the sky of Tengri.
TEXT.Italian: I, Qaghan Bumin, was called slave, but I am free. And by rights of sharp swords the son of free men, forging the strength of my people to ride under the sky of Tengri.
TEXT.Spanish: I, Qaghan Bumin, was called slave, but I am free. And by rights of sharp swords the son of free men, forging the strength of my people to ride under the sky of Tengri.

TEXT.English: I would like to know as to what you do with your prisoners. My punishment is the heaviest, for I would forgive you and set you to ride free between the west and the east.
TEXT.French: J'aimerais savoir ce que vous faites de vos prisonniers. Nul châtiment n'est plus lourd que le mien : je vous pardonnerais et vous ferais chevaucher librement d'ouest en est.
TEXT.German: I would like to know as to what you do with your prisoners. My punishment is the heaviest, for I would forgive you and set you to ride free between the west and the east.
TEXT.Italian: I would like to know as to what you do with your prisoners. My punishment is the heaviest, for I would forgive you and set you to ride free between the west and the east.
TEXT.Spanish: I would like to know as to what you do with your prisoners. My punishment is the heaviest, for I would forgive you and set you to ride free between the west and the east.

TEXT.English: By the blows of my well tempered sword I have conquered the greater part of the world to enlarge Samarkand and Bukhara, my capitals and residences; and you, pitiful creature, would exchange these two cities for a mole. Indeed, truth is safety.
TEXT.French: Avec mon épée trempée, j'ai conquis de vastes pans du monde pour agrandir Samarcande et Boukhara, mes capitales et résidences ; et toi, créature pitoyable, tu échangerais ces deux cités contre une taupe. La vérité est la seule sûreté.
TEXT.German: By the blows of my well tempered sword I have conquered the greater part of the world to enlarge Samarkand and Bukhara, my capitals and residences; and you, pitiful creature, would exchange these two cities for a mole. Indeed, truth is safety.
TEXT.Italian: By the blows of my well tempered sword I have conquered the greater part of the world to enlarge Samarkand and Bukhara, my capitals and residences; and you, pitiful creature, would exchange these two cities for a mole. Indeed, truth is safety.
TEXT.Spanish: By the blows of my well tempered sword I have conquered the greater part of the world to enlarge Samarkand and Bukhara, my capitals and residences; and you, pitiful creature, would exchange these two cities for a mole. Indeed, truth is safety.

TEXT.English: "You sacked one of our cities!"
TEXT.French: "Vous avez saccagé l'une de nos villes !"
TEXT.German: "Ihr habt eine unserer Städte geplündert!"
TEXT.Italian: "Hai saccheggiato una delle nostre città!"
TEXT.Spanish: "¡Saqueasteis una de nuestras ciudades!"

TEXT.English: My fellow ruler, the Middle Kingdom will teach you that your voice is all too important. To serve your subjects, do not mumble, do not hesitate! Speak loudly, clearly, and without fear!
TEXT.French: Camarade souverain, l'Empire du Milieu peut t'apprendre l'importance de ta voix. Pour servir tes sujets, ne bredouille pas, n'hésite pas ! Parle fort, avec clarté, sans crainte !
TEXT.German: My fellow ruler, the Middle Kingdom will teach you that your voice is all too important. To serve your subjects, do not mumble, do not hesitate! Speak loudly, clearly, and without fear!
TEXT.Italian: My fellow ruler, the Middle Kingdom will teach you that your voice is all too important. To serve your subjects, do not mumble, do not hesitate! Speak loudly, clearly, and without fear!
TEXT.Spanish: My fellow ruler, the Middle Kingdom will teach you that your voice is all too important. To serve your subjects, do not mumble, do not hesitate! Speak loudly, clearly, and without fear!

TEXT.English: So much in life is a mirror. The mirror of bronze gave me better clothes, the mirror of antiquity showed me the rise and fall of my realm, the mirror of friends will show you yourself. I have lost my mirror! Do not lose yours! Do not forget who is dear to you!
TEXT.French: Tant de choses dans la vie sont des miroirs. Le miroir de bronze m'a donné de beaux habits, celui de l'antiquité m'a montré la grandeur et le déclin de mon royaume, celui de tes amis te montrera tel que tu es. J'ai perdu mon miroir ! Ne perds pas le tien ! N'oublie pas ceux qui te sont chers !
TEXT.German: So much in life is a mirror. The mirror of bronze gave me better clothes, the mirror of antiquity showed me the rise and fall of my realm, the mirror of friends will show you yourself. I have lost my mirror! Do not lose yours! Do not forget who is dear to you!
TEXT.Italian: So much in life is a mirror. The mirror of bronze gave me better clothes, the mirror of antiquity showed me the rise and fall of my realm, the mirror of friends will show you yourself. I have lost my mirror! Do not lose yours! Do not forget who is dear to you!
TEXT.Spanish: So much in life is a mirror. The mirror of bronze gave me better clothes, the mirror of antiquity showed me the rise and fall of my realm, the mirror of friends will show you yourself. I have lost my mirror! Do not lose yours! Do not forget who is dear to you!

TEXT.English: As Shahanshah of Persia, I have inherited the power and richness of a thousand lands conquered by our vast armies. It would be wise that you leave aside your pride and accept my greatness, unless you want to be a new acquisition for it.
TEXT.French: En tant que shahanshah de Perse, j'ai hérité de la puissance et de la richesse de mille terres conquises par nos vastes armées. Il serait sage de laisser votre orgueil de côté et d'accepter ma grandeur, à moins de vouloir être la prochaine acquisition à y contribuer.
TEXT.German: As Shahanshah of Persia, I have inherited the power and richness of a thousand lands conquered under our vast armies. It is wise to you stand dawn your pride and accept my greatness or be a new acquisition for it.
TEXT.Italian: As Shahanshah of Persia, I have inherited the power and richness of a thousand lands conquered under our vast armies. It is wise to you stand dawn your pride and accept my greatness or be a new acquisition for it.
TEXT.Spanish: As Shahanshah of Persia, I have inherited the power and richness of a thousand lands conquered under our vast armies. It is wise to you stand dawn your pride and accept my greatness or be a new acquisition for it.

TEXT.English: As your name is the King of Kings, all your emperorship over us connotes that your wise men should be wiser than ours. Either you send us an explanation of this game of chess or send revenue and tribute us.
TEXT.French: En tant que roi des rois, l'empire que vous exercez sur nous laisse croire que vos sages sont plus sages que les nôtres. Soit vous nous expliquez ce jeu des échecs, soit vous nous demandez un tribut.
TEXT.German: As your name is the King of Kings, all your emperorship over us connotes that your wise men should be wiser than ours. Either you send us an explanation of this game of chess or send revenue and tribute us.
TEXT.Italian: As your name is the King of Kings, all your emperorship over us connotes that your wise men should be wiser than ours. Either you send us an explanation of this game of chess or send revenue and tribute us.
TEXT.Spanish: As your name is the King of Kings, all your emperorship over us connotes that your wise men should be wiser than ours. Either you send us an explanation of this game of chess or send revenue and tribute us.

TEXT.English: If the rich could hire the poor to die for them, the poor would make a very nice living. Anyhow, what riches may your so-called [CT_EMPIRE] possess?
TEXT.French: Salutations ! Je suis [OUR_NAME], je règne sur l'[OUR_EMPIRE]. Je souhaite que nos deux grands peuples puissent vivre en paix.
TEXT.German: Seid gegrüßt! Ich bin [OUR_NAME], Staatsoberhaupt des [OUR_EMPIRE:3]es. Ich hoffe, unsere großartigen Völker werden in Frieden zusammenleben.
TEXT.Italian: Saluti! Io sono [OUR_NAME] dell'[OUR_EMPIRE]. Spero che i nostri due grandi popoli possano vivere in pace.
TEXT.Spanish: Saludos. ¡Soy [OUR_NAME], del [OUR_EMPIRE]! Espero que nuestros dos grandes pueblos puedan vivir en paz.

TEXT.English: You are a broken spirit, [CT_NAME]. First mend yourself, and then mend others!
TEXT.French: Vos bavardages incessants ne nous amusent pas, [CT_NAME] !
TEXT.German: Euer bedeutungsloses Geschwafel amüsiert uns ganz und gar nicht, [CT_NAME]!
TEXT.Italian: I tuoi balbettii senza senso non sono affatto divertenti, [CT_NAME]!
TEXT.Spanish: ¡No nos hace gracia vuestra cháchara absurda, [CT_NAME]!

TEXT.English: I have heard of an old saying amongst the elders here: Rejoice not at thine enemy's fall - but don't rush to pick him up either.
TEXT.French: La guerre est très déplaisante, mais parfois nécessaire. Il apparaît que nous sommes dans cette situation, aussi devons-nous rejeter votre requête. Cette entrevue est terminée.
TEXT.German: Kriege sind eine höchst unangenehme Sache, manchmal aber auch unumgänglich. Und wie ich höre, ist das in diesem Fall so, deshalb muss ich Euer Anliegen zurückweisen. Diese Unterhaltung ist beendet!
TEXT.Italian: La guerra non è per niente piacevole, ma a volte è necessaria. Questa è una di quelle volte, perciò dobbiamo respingere le tue suppliche. L'udienza termina qui.
TEXT.Spanish: La guerra es harto desagradable, pero a veces resulta necesaria. Nos informan de que ésta es una de esas veces, así que debemos rechazar vuestras súplicas. La audiencia ha terminado.

TEXT.English: Would you like some of our traditional soup, [CT_NAME]? Worries go down better with soup than without.
TEXT.French: Je vous souhaite la bienvenue ! Venez, allons détruire nos ennemis du haut de nos chars et laissons cinquante mille cadavres sur le champ de bataille pour le festin des corbeaux !
TEXT.German: Willkommen! Lasst uns unsere Streitwagen anspannen und unsere Feinde vernichten! Mögen die Gefallenen auf dem Schlachtfeld ein Festmahl für die Geier sein!
TEXT.Italian: Salve, ti do il benvenuto! Montiamo sulle bighe e distruggiamo i nemici, lasceremo sul campo di battaglia solamente i cadaveri perché se ne sfamino i corvi!
TEXT.Spanish: ¡Os saludamos, camarada! Venga, montemos en los carros, destruyamos a nuestros enemigos y dejemos cincuenta mil cadáveres pudriéndose en el campo de batalla como pasto para los cuervos.

TEXT.English: If not for fear, sin would be sweet. I would sin again and again, [CT_NAME], just to get rid of you...
TEXT.French: Bonjour, [CT_NAME]. A quoi devons-nous cette interruption inattendue ?
TEXT.German: Guten Tag, [CT_NAME]. Was beschert mir diese unerwartete Störung?
TEXT.Italian: Buongiorno a te, [CT_NAME]. A cosa dobbiamo questa interruzione inaspettata?
TEXT.Spanish: Buenos días tengáis, [CT_NAME]. ¿A qué debemos esta interrupción tan inesperada?

TEXT.English: If charity cost nothing, the world would be full of philanthropists. Charity, [CT_NAME]. Charity.
TEXT.French: Les [CT_CIV_ADJ] sont dans le besoin, [CT_NAME]. J'espère que vous ne les décevrez pas.
TEXT.German: Das [CT_CIV_ADJ:3] Volk befindet sich in einer üblen Notlage, [CT_NAME]! Enttäuscht uns nicht!
TEXT.Italian: Il popolo [CT_CIV_ADJ:1] vive nell'indigenza, [CT_NAME]. Non deluderci.
TEXT.Spanish: El pueblo [CT_CIV_ADJ:1] tiene una gran necesidad, [CT_NAME]. No nos decepcionéis.

TEXT.English: Ask about your neighbors, then buy the house. That's what I've heard.
TEXT.French: Nous avons des besoins, [CT_NAME]. Veuillez les satisfaire.
TEXT.German: Auch wir haben Bedürfnisse, [CT_NAME]! Und es ist an Euch, sie zu befriedigen!
TEXT.Italian: Abbiamo delle necessità, [CT_NAME]. Ti preghiamo di accettarle.
TEXT.Spanish: Tenemos necesidades, [CT_NAME]. Satisfacedlas, por favor.

TEXT.English: We've all heard of charity to the weak, but what about charity to the strong, huh?
TEXT.French: Donnez aux [CT_CIV_SHORT] ce qui leur revient, [CT_NAME] ! Nous ne vous le demanderons pas deux fois.
TEXT.German: Gebt [CT_CIV_SHORT], was ihm zusteht, [CT_NAME]! Wir werden Euch kein zweites Mal darum bitten!
TEXT.Italian: Dona ciò che ti richiede [CT_CIV_SHORT:2], [CT_NAME]! Non te lo chiederemo una seconda volta!
TEXT.Spanish: ¡Dadle a [CT_CIV_SHORT] lo que le corresponde, [CT_NAME]! No os lo pediremos otra vez.

TEXT.English: You can discuss the almighty and the prophet with me or you can simply convert now. What do you say [CT_NAME]?
TEXT.French: Vous pouvez discuter terreur et prophétie avec moi ou simplement vous convertir maintenant. Qu'en pensez vous, [CT_NAME]?
TEXT.Spanish: Puede debatir el todopoderoso y al profeta conmigo o puede simplemente convertirse ahora. ¿Qué dice, [CT_NAME]?
